name: Bar-winged Wren-babbler
description: It got its name from the black wavy lines on its ochre back.
reproduction: No data available from the wild.
attractions: It is very inconspicuous and quiet, foraging mostly on the ground. During the breeding season, it emits a resonant song lasting a few seconds.
breeding: We’ve kept them since 2007; the first offspring were raised in 2011, marking a European first.
